channel.title: Frontend Deploy :: My Hugo Site
channel.description: Architectural model Domain: Route 53 (DNS) + ACM (SSL Certificate). CDN: CloudFront (Global Edge Network). Storage (Primary): S3 Singapore (ap-southeast-1). Storage (Failover): S3 N. Virginia (us-east-1). Replication: Automatically copy code from Singapore -> Virginia. Security: OAC (Origin Access Control) - Private Bucket. Table of Contents Prerequisites S3 and Replication Route 53 and ACM ClouFront and Failover S3 Policy DNS Record Deploy and Test

item.title: Prerequisites
item.description: Preparation Requirements A registered domain name (e.g. sgutodolist.com) With AWS Free Tier accounts, Route 53 domain registration is not supported. Therefore, in this project, the domain is registered with a third-party domain provider and then hosted on Amazon Route 53. An AWS account A successfully built ReactJS project AWS CLI (optional, for testing and validation) Node.js and npm installed on the local machine Required Knowledge Basic understanding of Amazon S3, CloudFront, and Route 53

item.title: S3 and Replication
item.description: PHASE 1: STORAGE PREPARATION (S3 & REPLICATION) This phase focuses on creating a durable storage layer for frontend resources and setting up an automated cross-region synchronization mechanism. Step 1.1: Create the Primary Bucket (Singapore) Open the Amazon S3 Console and select the Asia Pacific (Singapore) region. Click Create bucket. Bucket name: sgutodolist-frontend-sg Object Ownership: ACLs disabled (Recommended) Block Public Access: ✅ Block all public access (The bucket must remain private because CloudFront OAC will be used.) Bucket Versioning: ✅ Enable (Required for cross-region replication.) Default encryption: Server-side encryption with Amazon S3 managed keys (SSE-S3) Click Create bucket.

item.title: Route 53 and ACM
item.description: PHASE 2: DOMAIN & SECURITY PREPARATION (ROUTE 53 & ACM) Before creating the CloudFront distribution, the domain name system (DNS) and SSL certificates must be properly prepared. Step 2.1: Create a Hosted Zone (If Not Exists) Navigate to Amazon Route 53 → Hosted zones. If the domain sgutodolist.com does not exist in the list: Click Create hosted zone. Domain name: sgutodolist.com Type: Public hosted zone Click Create. Update Name Servers at the domain provider (This project uses a domain purchased from a third-party registrar.)

item.title: ClouFront and Failover
item.description: STAGE 3: CONFIGURATION CLOUDFRONT (CDN & FAILOVER) STEP 3.1: Create Distribution Step 1: Get started Distribution name: sgutodolist-frontend-cloudfront Distribution type: Keep Single website or app. Domain: In the Route 53 managed domain box, enter: sgutodolist.com. (If there is an Alternate domain names box, enter www.sgutodolist.com if the interface allows, otherwise we will add it later). Click Next. Step 2: Specify origin Origin type: Select Amazon S3. Origin: Click on the search box, select bucket Singapore: sgutodolist-frontend-sg....

item.title: S3 Policy
item.description: STAGE 4: S3 PERMITS (POLICY) CloudFront needs a “permission” to pull files from your 2 closed buckets. In CloudFront > Origins tab. Select Origin Singapore > Edit > Copy policy. Open a new tab > S3 Console > Bucket sgutodolist-frontend-sg. Permissions tab > Bucket Policy > Edit > Paste > Save. Repeat with Bucket Virginia: Go back to CloudFront > Select Origin Virginia > Edit > Copy policy. Go to S3 sgutodolist-frontend-us > Permissions > Bucket Policy > Paste > Save.

item.title: DNS Record
item.description: PHASE 5: POINT OFFICIAL DOMAIN (DNS RECORD) Go to Route 53 > Hosted zones > sgutodolist.com. Create Record for Root domain: Click Create record. Record name: (leave blank). Type: A. Alias: Yes (Swipe the button to the right). Route traffic to: Alias ​​to CloudFront distribution. Choose distribution: Select the CloudFront domain (e.g. d123...cloudfront.net). Click Create records. Create Record for WWW: Do the same, but fill in www for Record name. ⬅ STEP 5: S3 Policy STEP 7: Deploy and Test ➡

item.title: Deploy and Test
item.description: PHASE 6: DEPLOY & TESTING Step 6.1: Build & Deploy On your local computer (in the React project folder): # 1. Build to the production folder npm run build # 2. Upload to the MAIN bucket (Singapore) # Note: Just upload to Sing, AWS will automatically copy to US aws s3 sync build/ s3://sgutodolist-frontend-sg --delete # 3. Clear the CloudFront cache so users can see the new code immediately aws cloudfront create-invalidation --distribution-id <ID_CUA_BAN> --paths "/*" Step 6.2: Test Go to https://sgutodolist.com.
